channel.title: Safest way to archive an Auxy track?
channel.description:
I finished a song. It includes Auxy samples and synths, but also custom samples loaded from my iCloud.
I don't want to keep it on my iPad forever. What's the best way to archive it so I could reload it in the future, without risk of missing samples or sounds?

item.title: Safest way to archive an Auxy track?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Would love to see a proper ‘Collect and Save’ option in the Export settings in a not-too-distant future.

Read full topic
item.source: Safest way to archive an Auxy track?

item.title: Safest way to archive an Auxy track?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Yup, or even better, as you’re working on a track, give it a subfolder with the samples used in the track. Cause if you have a mess of Samples in “Auxy/Samples” you’re gonna have a hard time sorting it out. Just don’t make any folders before “Auxy/Samples/(song title)” - will only go down one level under Samples

Read full topic
item.source: Safest way to archive an Auxy track?

item.title: Safest way to archive an Auxy track?
item.dc:creator: corey
item.description:
If I understand correctly, once you’ve finished with a track, you figure out every sample you use, you duplicate it to a song-specific folder and then re-assign the same in Auxy to point to the one in the song-specific folder? Am I saying that back correctly? Thanks!

Read full topic
item.source: Safest way to archive an Auxy track?

item.title: Safest way to archive an Auxy track?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description: Read full topic
item.source: Safest way to archive an Auxy track?

item.title: Safest way to archive an Auxy track?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
I do this all the time. Well I keep it in iCloud but you don’t have to.

Make a subfolder off the Auxy/Samples folder with the song title or something that makes sense. Fix your drum tracks with the samples to point to this folder. Open up iCloud.com on a PC or you can even use the Files app on iOS to copy the folder with the samples and the Auxy project file somewhere else.

A little hoop jumpy, but at least you can do it all on your device

Read full topic
item.source: Safest way to archive an Auxy track?
